item.source: New Youtube layout (aka 27th new Youtube layout for this year)

item.title: New Youtube layout (aka 27th new Youtube layout for this year)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:9, topic:465799”][quote author=Niall link=topic=572172.msg4137671#msg4137671 date=1351851281]
http://i.imgur.com/xwBVQ.jpg
[/quote]

imgur?

Haha, are you by chance a Redditor?[/quote]

I’m hesitant to call myself a redditor but I browse the front (default, logged out) front page until there’s no more links left on a 2-3 day basis and frequently check comment threads

I however use imgur because it’s the only good free image host that doesn’t require registration, the last similar image host was imageshack back in pre-2006 before it turned to shit

photobucket blatantly does not load pictures for me (unless direct linked with [img]), flickr may or may not load pictures, sometimes they’re fine and sometimes it takes the better part of 30 seconds on an idle 20mbit home broadband connection where everything else is instant, imageshack is fine if you can get a direct link but so god help you if you cannot, tinypic is in a similar position to the rest where it’s fine if you can get a direct link but it’s almost never in the same spot twice, you get the picture (or not if you’re using any of these hosts)

Davidi2:

Is this really #27 or is that an exaggeration? I’d be interested in knowing the actual number

it’s an exaggeration but it definitely is at least the 3rd major layout change this year

I’ve used youtube more than the average person since 2010 (and just averagely before that) and this is just one of the dozen major change they’ve done to a layout, it usually goes that they start beta testing a new colour/button scheme then out of nowhere they’ll introduce a new radical layout which moves everything around, sometimes in non-intuitive places, and then a week later they’ll realise what a horrible mistake they’ve made and actually fix all the issues with a layout and they’ll repeat in 2-6 months

the issue I have with the layout changes is they rarely add new, useful features, the new layouts always change the feature availability around sometimes making browsing youtube an absolute nightmare, an example of this would be that if you are subscribed to a lot of people (like myself) and all you want to do is watch videos they upload then you’re out of luck, on the old layouts all your subscriber videos would be on the front page, nowadays they’re on the front page but you also get comments, likes by subscribers so you have to filter to uploads only, and then show every video and not just highlights, and the amount of videos shown only goes back so far

Read full topic
